title: San Benito man charged with manslaughter in teen's death
content:
Jonathan Gamez was read three separate counts by Judge Benjamin Euresti, Jr.: manslaughter, tamper/fabricate physical evidence with intent to impair and murder. His bond was set at $175,000.
At one of his family member’s home in San Benito, Gamez handled a .40-caliber pistol that set off and hit his friend, 17-year-old Devin Leal, in the head, police said. Leal was pronounced dead at the scene.
Authorities said Gamez admitted to handling the handgun when it discharged.
The next hearing is scheduled for November 17.S
